intro: Ruprechtia concinna, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in woodland or rocky habitats. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, while its flowers range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring. Ruprechtia concinna is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
